CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4 shows the J-V curves of the optimized PSCs based on the three polymers under illumination of AM 1.5 simulated solar light ( 100 mW cm^-2 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSCs (Polymer Solar Cells) |
| Three polymers |
| AM 1.5 simulated solar light |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Three polymers |

The other entities in the paragraph do not clearly refer to material names.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4 shows the J-V curves of the optimized PSCs based on the three polymers under illumination of AM 1.5 simulated solar light ( 100 mW cm^-2 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| ------------- |
| J-V curves |
| optimized PSCs |
| three polymers |
| illumination |
| AM 1.5 simulated solar light |
| 100 mW cm^-2 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| ------------- |
| J-V curves of optimized PSCs |
| three polymers |
| AM 1.5 simulated solar light |
| illumination with intensity of 100 mW cm^-2 |

Note: "optimized PSCs" can be considered a material property as it refers to the specific properties of the optimized polymer solar cells.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4 shows the J-V curves of the optimized PSCs based on the three polymers under illumination of AM 1.5 simulated solar light ( 100 mW cm^-2 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| -------------- |
| 4 shows the J-V curves |
| of the optimized PSCs |
| based on the three polymers |
| under illumination of |
| AM 1.5 simulated solar light |
| ( 100 mW cm^-2 ) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| -------------- |
| J-V curves of the optimized PSCs |
| based on the three polymers |
| under illumination of AM 1.5 simulated solar light |
| ( 100 mW cm^-2 ) |

Explanation:

- "4 shows" is not a property value, it refers to the figure number in the text.
- "J-V curves of the optimized PSCs based on the three polymers" is a property value, it refers to the electrical characteristics (J-V curves) of the optimized Polymer Solar Cells (PSCs) made from three different polymers.
- "under illumination of AM 1.5 simulated solar light ( 100 mW cm^-2 )" is a property value, it refers to the condition under which the measurements were taken (AM 1.5 simulated solar light with an intensity of 100 mW cm^-2).
